data.title: Print option in File menu
data.body:
Please add a Print option to the application in the File menu.

While many scripts wont necessarily be printed onto paper due to code length etc having the option to print to pdf which would preserve code keyword colouring, formatting etc would be very useful for inclusion of code sections into training documents etc

data.title: I keep corrupting code with inadvertent multi-selections
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.12.2 (19222cdc84ce72202478ba1cec5cb557b71163de, 2017-05-10T13:13:11.413Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.5.0
- Extensions: none
---

I frequently get into a state where the editor appears to have multiple selections, even though some of them are not visible on the screen. When I start typing with the intent of replacing the visible selection, I end up corrupting the other instance of the same text elsewhere in the file, often times without realizing it until much later. This has been a problem since the early days of VSCode, but I've never been able to figure out repro steps before.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Find a piece of text in your code file that occurs more than once (e.g. a method name).
2. Double-click on the text to select it. Press command-E to set it as the search text.
3. Click somewhere else
4. Repeat step 2. Double-click on the same piece of text as before, press command-E again.
5. At this point, you'll be able to observe two separate blinking insertion points as shown in the attached screen shot.
6. Start typing to replace the selection. Note that the replacement text affects both instances.

![screen shot 2017-05-19 at 9 06 36 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7040122/26272820/15dcb3a8-3cd7-11e7-9bf3-3c8a29d0ee3e.png)

data.title: Select previous file by default when using Ctrl-P
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.12.1
- OS Version: Linux archLinux 4.10.13-1-ARCH x86_64

It's a **suggestion**: Show the first item in the file list as the previous file instead of the current one when pressing Ctrl-P.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create two files `foo.js` and `bar.js`
2. Jump to `foo.js` by pressing Ctrl-P and typing `foo.js`
3. Jump to `bar.js` by pressing Ctrl-P and typing `bar.js`. 
4. In this step I would like to go back to the previous file `foo.js`. Notice that I'm in `bar.js`. So if I press Ctrl-P right now, the first item in the file list is `bar.js`, which is the current file. I have to type a character `f` to change the first item to `foo.js` so I can jump to it. This behavior is different from Intellij, where the first item would be the previous file instead of the current one(i.e. it will show `foo.js` as the first choice in the file list when you are in `bar.js`), and I think Intellij's strategy is more convenient to me. After all, there is no use to show the current file as the first item of the file list seeing that I'm already in the file, and we may need to jump to the previous file constantly.

data.title: Allow extensions to use theme colors
data.body: Some extensions contribute ui for example in html preview and decorations. It would be good if those colors could be sourced from the theme. Imagine you have a test coverage extension that out green/red indicators next to the line. These colors could be based on the diff editor addition/deletion colors.

data.title: Launching Code to edit a file with an unsaved file from prior hot exit focuses incorrect file on start
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.12.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 v1703 15063.296

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Launch Code
2. New File
3. Type 'asdljahdfg'
4. Quit Code
5. Right-click any file in Explorer > Open with Code
6. File opens, then after a moment hot-exit restores prior tab and tab with content 'asdljahdfg' grabs focus

Expected results: the file I right-clicked remains focused.

data.title: Fixed fails running unit tests VS Code
data.body:
- The bug is from `jsdom-no-contextify` its `Element` has no `classList`
- I mocked classList just for run test (`all.js`)
- I suggest not remove `Unit Tests` from `launch.json`, it's useful for debug tests.
- I suggest leave `-g` mocha argument for newbies in vscode enviroment (like me)

refers to #26699

data.title: Feature request: Repeating colored indent lines
data.body:
Here's an idea to use 4 colors from the theme as colors for the indent lines; the pattern would repeat however deep the nesting goes. It would be helpful to distinguish indent lines from each other.

This gif should explain it well enough:

![vscode_lines_idea](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/764290/26268521/8c8c5702-3cbd-11e7-95f4-cf027212b4bb.gif)


As indent lines currently are, they bleed together and aren't as useful to me as I'd like. I suppose I could use 4 spaces for tabs, but I'm not a savage.

I like the ideas to [highlight selected indent guides](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/14017 ), and to have a [vertical ruler](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/15027) as well.

data.title: Add a dedicated page for customization
data.body: Related: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/26893, https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/26892 What is we could augmented the welcome page to add a dedicated customize page. This could be the first thing users saw on first launch: Basically a bunch of tiles with images/gifs that make it really easy to see what a setting does. The order of the settings/extensions could be based on the amount we feel the setting could be a deal breaker for the user. After first launch it could revert to the regular welcome page. These three welcome page buttons could also be combined into one to open this "customize page": /cc @Microsoft/vscode

data.title: Make SearchWidget dependencies injectable
data.body:
Small cleanup, does not change any logic.

- Remove searchWidget's unused dependency on `IInstantiationService`
- Remove searchViewlet's (now) unused dependency on `IKeybindingService`
- Make searchViewlet's constructor usable with `IInstantiationService`

data.title: Feature request: Wrap control statement content when adding open brace

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
I would like vscode to handle adding opening braces like Sublime Text does when adding one as part of a control statement (`if`, `while`, `for`, etc) with a single indented statement.

Here is an example gif of Sublime Text:
![wrap-statement](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1206952/26266237/c93df6ea-3ca1-11e7-9759-ef91a3ddb9cb.gif)

Notice that if there are multiple indented statements, it does not wrap them.

I think it's a delightful experience and a common workflow, and I've missed it since migrating from Sublime Text to vscode.

It may be reasonable to implement this with an extension, but I wasn't able to identify the appropriate api to use in implementing this feature as an extension.

data.title: Does vscode support debugging of javascript coming from a cshtml?
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version:1.12.2
- OS Version:macOS 10.12.4

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a simple project. 
dotnet new mvc --auth none
2. Add some javascript and set a breakpoint inside a .cshtml  
when I hover over the breakpoint I get the following message:

No executable code of the debugger’s target code type is associated with this line. Possible causes include: conditional compilation, compiler optimizations, or the target architecture of this line is not supported by the current debugger code type.

3. Create a .js file and write some js and add it to the .cshtml with a script tag and set a breakpoint
when I hover over the breakpoint I get the following message:

No symbols have been loaded for this document.

Comment:

I try running two debugger one for .net core and the chrome debug but isn't working, on Visual Studio 2017 you can do that so I want to know if this is a limitation on vscode?

data.title: Feature Request: Add "Open to the Side" option to editor tab right-click menu
data.body:
#26889 - link to pull request

Currently the only way to open a file to the side is in the right-click menu option in the file-browser tree, or through a hot-key. So anytime you want to move a background tab over, you have to switch to it, hot-key it over to the side then find your original file back on the left side again, (or find it in the file-tree and right click it there, which in big projects can be tough). 

I already made a small patch that implements the feature. Here's a clip of it working with splits in horizontal and vertical mode.

![vscode_opentoside](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19689932/26265033/a3805812-3cb5-11e7-8c3b-54176519e0e8.gif)


Sorry for not making a Feature-Request first, won't happen again :) I look forward to hearing what you all think !

Thanks, cheers :beers:

data.title: Pin tabs similar to Visual Studio

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- `IEditorInput.pinned` from `boolean` to `export enum Pinned {NO, SOFT, HARD}` . NO = preview, SOFT is the current vscode pinned, and HARD is pin similar to Visual Studio
- `CloseAllButPinned` action and methods that close all editor where `pinned !== HARD`
- DblClick in title pin hard
- replaced `CloseAllEditors` by `CloseAllButPinned` in hotkey and explorerviewlet  
- TODO:
  - [ ] Fix the terminology to clarify and one just one term for each concept
    - NO/PREVIEW
    - SOFT/KEEPOPEN
    - HARD/PINNED
  - [ ] Unpin
  - [ ] better UI
  - [ ] remember pinned tabs on vscode restart
  - [ ] more tests (just one test with HARD pin included)  
> I suggest new PRs for TODO's to avoid mergeconflicts

refers to #12622
